The in-console calculator is available exclusively to AWS account holders, including standalone accounts and those within an AWS organization (member and management accounts).

shortDescription: Create private certificates to identify resources and protect data
detailDescription: AWS Private Certificate Authority (AWS Private CA ) is a hosted private certificate authority service to issue and revoke digital certificates deployed in your organization's private PKI, including on AWS managed resources and in the Internet of Things.

shortDescription: Automate management for container and serverless deployments
detailDescription: AWS Proton creates and manages standardized infrastructure and deployment tooling for developers and their serverless and container-based applications.

shortDescription: Build an organization-specific knowledge resource for your cloud community
detailDescription: AWS re:Post Private is a private version of AWS re:Post for enterprises with Enterprise Support or Enterprise On-Ramp Support plans. It provides access to knowledge and experts to accelerate cloud adoption and increase developer productivity. With your organization-specific private re:Post, you can build an organization-specific developer community that drives efficiencies at scale and provides access to valuable knowledge resources. Additionally, re:Post Private centralizes trusted AWS technical content and offers private discussion forums to improve how your teams collaborate internally and with AWS to remove technical obstacles, accelerate innovation, and scale more efficiently in the cloud.

shortDescription: Prepare and protect your applications from disruptions
detailDescription: AWS Resilience Hub helps you proactively prepare and protect your AWS applications from disruptions. AWS Resilience Hub provides resiliency assessment and validation to help you identify and resolve issues before releasing applications into production.

shortDescription: Simple, secure service to share AWS resources
detailDescription: Learn how to manage your AWS resources.

shortDescription: Search for and discover relevant resources across AWS
detailDescription: Learn how to manage your AWS resources.

shortDescription: See your resources across the AWS Regions in your AWS account
detailDescription: Learn how to manage your AWS resources.

shortDescription: Develop, test, and deploy robotics applications
detailDescription: AWS RoboMaker is a service that makes it easy to develop, simulate, and deploy intelligent robotics applications at scale.

shortDescription: Build serverless applications on AWS
detailDescription: The AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) is an open-source framework that enables you to build serverless applications on AWS. It provides you with a template specification to define your serverless application, and a command line interface (CLI) tool.

shortDescription: Convert source schema and most code to target-compatible format
detailDescription: The AWS Schema Conversion Tool makes heterogeneous database migrations easy by automatically converting the source database schema and a majority of the custom code to a format compatible with the target database. The custom code that the tool converts includes views, stored procedures, and functions. Any code that the tool cannot convert automatically is clearly marked so that you can convert it yourself. For supported source and target databases, see the User Guide, following.

shortDescription: Develop applications with .NET-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The SDK for .NET makes it easier for Windows developers to build .NET applications that tap into cost-effective, scalable, and reliable AWS infrastructure services such as Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, and Amazon DynamoDB.

shortDescription: Develop applications with C++-specific APIs
detailDescription: Get started quickly with AWS using the AWS SDK for C++. The SDK is a modern, open-source C++ library that makes it easy to integrate your C++ application with AWS services like Amazon S3, Amazon Kinesis, and Amazon DynamoDB.

shortDescription: Develop applications with Go-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for Go provides APIs and utilities that developers can use to quickly integrate Go applications with AWS services like Amazon S3 and Amazon EC2.

shortDescription: Develop applications with Java-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for Java provides a Java API for Amazon Web Services infrastructure services. Using the SDK, you can build applications on top of Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, Amazon DynamoDB, and more.

shortDescription: Develop applications with JavaScript-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for JavaScript enables developers to build libraries and applications that use AWS services. You can use the JavaScript API in the browser and inside Node.js applications on the server.

shortDescription: Develop applications with PHP-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: Get started quickly using Amazon Web Services with the AWS SDK for PHP. The SDK is a modern, open source PHP library that makes it easy to integrate your PHP application with AWS services like Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, and Amazon DynamoDB.

shortDescription: Develop applications with Python-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for Python (Boto3) provides a Python API for AWS infrastructure services. Using the SDK for Python, you can build applications on top of Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, Amazon DynamoDB, and more.

shortDescription: Develop applications with Ruby-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for Ruby helps you to get started building applications using Amazon Web Services infrastructure services, including Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, Amazon DynamoDB, and more.

shortDescription: Rotate, manage, and retrieve secrets
detailDescription: AWS Secrets Manager helps you to securely encrypt, store, and retrieve credentials for your databases and other services. Instead of hardcoding credentials in your apps, you can make calls to Secrets Manager to retrieve your credentials whenever needed. Secrets Manager helps you protect access to your IT resources and data by enabling you to rotate and manage access to your secrets.

shortDescription: Unified security and compliance center
detailDescription: AWS Security Hub provides you with a comprehensive view of the security state of your AWS resources. Security Hub collects security data from across AWS accounts and services, and helps you analyze your security trends to identify and prioritize the security issues across your AWS environment.

shortDescription: Helps you respond to and receive CIRT assistance for security events
detailDescription: AWS Security Incident Response helps organizations quickly prepare for, respond to, and recover from security incidents.

shortDescription: Discover, deploy, and publish serverless applications
detailDescription: The AWS Serverless Application Repository is a managed repository for serverless applications. It enables teams, organizations, and individual developers to find, deploy, publish, share, store, and easily assemble serverless architectures.

shortDescription: Create and use standardized products
detailDescription: AWS Service Catalog enables IT administrators to create, manage, and distribute portfolios of approved products to end users, who can then access the products they need in a personalized portal. Typical products include servers, databases, websites, or applications that are deployed using AWS resources (for example, an Amazon EC2 instance or an Amazon RDS database). You can control which users have access to specific products to enforce compliance with organizational business standards, manage product lifecycles, and help users find and launch products with confidence.

shortDescription: Provision, manage, and operate AWS resources within ITSM tools
detailDescription: AWS Service Management Connector (SMC) enables users to provision, manage, and operate AWS resources and capabilities in familiar IT Service Management (ITSM) tooling (for example, ServiceNow and Atlassian). These integrations enable organizations to migrate and adopt AWS faster and at-scale. With AWS Service Management Connector, you can manage and govern AWS resources directly through your organization's existing operations management tool and system of record.

shortDescription: DDoS protection
detailDescription: AWS provides two levels of protection against DDoS attacks: AWS Shield Standard and AWS Shield Advanced. AWS Shield Standard is automatically included at no extra cost beyond what you already pay for AWS WAF and your other AWS services. For added protection against DDoS attacks, AWS offers AWS Shield Advanced. AWS Shield Advanced provides expanded DDoS attack protection for your Amazon EC2 instances, Elastic Load Balancing load balancers, Amazon CloudFront distributions, and Amazon Route 53 hosted zones.

shortDescription: Find help signing in and out of your account
Validate AWS Lambda and IoT device code against a digital signature
detailDescription: With AWS Signer, you can cryptographically sign computer code for AWS Lambda applications and AWS-supported IoT devices.

shortDescription: Build and run large-scale spatial simulations in the AWS Cloud
detailDescription: AWS SimSpace Weaver distributes your workload across multiple instances. SimSpace Weaver manages the infrastructure and network communication between the instances that run your workload.

shortDescription: Move petabytes of data to and from AWS, or process data at the edge
detailDescription: The AWS Snowball Edge devices help customers who need to run operations in austere, non-data center environments, and in locations where there's no consistent network connectivity. You can use these devices to locally and cost-effectively access the storage and compute power of the AWS Cloud in places where an internet connection might not be an option.

shortDescription: Coordination for distributed applications
detailDescription: AWS Step Functions makes it easy to coordinate the components of distributed applications as a series of steps in a visual workflow. You can quickly build and run state machines to execute the steps of your application in a reliable and scalable fashion.

shortDescription: Hybrid storage integration
detailDescription: AWS Storage Gateway is a service that connects an on-premises software appliance with cloud-based storage to provide seamless and secure integration between your on-premises IT environment and the AWS storage infrastructure in the AWS Cloud.

shortDescription: Reduce risks and lower costs with ML-powered supply chain application
detailDescription: AWS Supply Chain is a cloud-based application that works with your enterprise resource planning (ERP) and supply chain management systems. Using AWS Supply Chain, you can connect and extract your inventory, supply, and demand related data from existing ERP or supply chain systems into a single data model.

shortDescription: Learn about the components and features that AWS Support provides
detailDescription: AWS Support provides support for users of Amazon Web Services.

shortDescription: Gain operational insights and take action
detailDescription: Use AWS Systems Manager to organize, monitor, and automate management tasks on your AWS resources.

shortDescription: Mitigate and recover from incidents affecting your applications hosted on AWS
detailDescription: Use AWS Systems Manager to organize, monitor, and automate management tasks on your AWS resources.

shortDescription: Automate the deployment and management of your telco networks on AWS
detailDescription: AWS Telco Network Builder (AWS TNB) is a managed 5G network automation service that enables communication service providers to rapidly deploy and cost-effectively manage their 5G networks on AWS.

shortDescription: Extension for hosted and on-premises Microsoft Azure DevOps
detailDescription: The AWS Toolkit for Azure DevOps contains tasks you can use in build and release definitions in Azure DevOps to interact with AWS services. The AWS Toolkit for Azure DevOps is available through the Visual Studio Marketplace.

shortDescription: Open-source plugin for the integrated development environments (IDEs) for JetBrains
detailDescription: The AWS Toolkit for JetBrains IDEs is an open source plug-in for the integrated development environments (IDEs) from JetBrains that makes it easier for developers to develop, debug, and deploy serverless applications that use Amazon Web Services. It includes features like credentials management and AWS Region management that simplify writing applications for Amazon Web Services.

service: AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio Code
shortDescription: Open-source extension for the Visual Studio Code editor
detailDescription: The AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio Code is a plugin for the Visual Studio Code (VS Code) editor. The Toolkit makes it easier for developers to develop, debug, and deploy applications that use Amazon Web Services.

shortDescription: PowerShell modules built on the functionality exposed by the SDK for .NET
detailDescription: AWS Tools for PowerShell and AWS Tools for PowerShell Core are PowerShell modules, built on functionality exposed by the SDK for .NET, that enable you to script operations on AWS resources from the PowerShell command line. Although you use the SDK's service clients and methods to implement the cmdlets, the cmdlets give you a PowerShell experience to specify parameters and handle results. For example, the cmdlets in both modules support PowerShell pipelining to pipe PowerShell objects to and from the cmdlets.

shortDescription: Fully managed SFTP, FTPS, and FTP service
detailDescription: AWS Transfer Family is a secure transfer service that stores your data in Amazon Simple Storage Service or Amazon Elastic File System and simplifies the migration of Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP), File Transfer Protocol Secure (FTPS), File Transfer Protocol (FTP), and Applicability Statement 2 (AS2) workflows to AWS.

shortDescription: Optimize performance and security
detailDescription: AWS Support provides support for users of Amazon Web Services.

shortDescription: Unifies the notification experience across AWS services
detailDescription: AWS User Notifications is an AWS service that provides a central location for your AWS notifications in the AWS Management Console. This includes AWS managed notifications from AWS Health and user-configured notifications generated by AWS services and events you specify. You can receive notifications for events through multiple channels, including email, Amazon Q Developer chat notifications, or AWS Console Mobile Application push notifications.

shortDescription: Provide secure access to corporate applications without a VPN
detailDescription: AWS Verified Access provides secure access to corporate applications without a VPN connection. It evaluates each request in real time and determines whether the user has access to the application.

shortDescription: Securely access your network resources
detailDescription: AWS Virtual Private Network (AWS VPN) establishes a secure and private tunnel from your network or device to the AWS Cloud. You can extend your existing on-premises network into a VPC, or connect to other AWS resources from a client. AWS VPN offers two types of private connectivity that feature the high availability and robust security necessary for your data.

shortDescription: Filter malicious web traffic
detailDescription: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that lets you monitor and manage web requests that are forwarded to protected AWS resources. With AWS WAF, you can protect resources such as Amazon CloudFront distributions, Amazon API Gateway REST APIs, Application Load Balancers, and AWS AppSync GraphQL APIs. You can use AWS WAF to inspect web requests for matches to conditions that you specify, such as the IP address that the requests originate from, the value of a specific request component, or the rate at which requests are being sent. AWS WAF can manage matching requests in a variety of ways, including counting them, blocking or allowing them, or sending challenges like CAPTCHA puzzles to the client user or browser.

shortDescription: Deliver ultra-low latency applications for 5G devices
detailDescription: AWS Wavelength allows developers to build applications that deliver ultra-low latencies to mobile devices and end users. Wavelength deploys standard AWS compute and storage services to the edge of telecommunication carriers' 5G networks. Developers can extend an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to one or more Wavelength Zones, and then use AWS resources like Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances to run applications that require ultra-low latency and a connection to AWS services in the Region.

shortDescription: Review and improve your workloads
detailDescription: Use the AWS Well-Architected Tool to review your workloads against current Amazon Web Services architectural best practices. The AWS Well-Architected Tool measures the workload and provides recommendations on how to improve your architecture.

shortDescription: Protect enterprise communications with end-to-end encryption
detailDescription: AWS Wickr is an end-to-end encrypted, enterprise communications service that enables secure one-to-one chats, group messaging, calling, file sharing, screen sharing, and more.

shortDescription: Analyze and debug your applications
detailDescription: AWS X-Ray makes it easy for developers to analyze the behavior of their distributed applications by providing request tracing, exception collection, and profiling capabilities.

shortDescription: Distribute incoming traffic across multiple targets
detailDescription: Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes your incoming traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances, containers, and IP addresses, in one or more Availability Zones. It monitors the health of its registered targets and routes traffic only to the healthy targets. You can select the type of load balancer that best suits your needs.

shortDescription: Real-time operating system for microcontrollers
detailDescription: FreeRTOS is a market-leading real-time operating system (RTOS) for microcontrollers and small microprocessors. Distributed freely under the MIT open source license, FreeRTOS includes a kernel and a growing set of libraries suitable for use across all industry sectors. FreeRTOS is built with an emphasis on reliability and ease of use.

shortDescription: Access Oracle Exadata infrastructure managed by OCI inside AWS data centers
detailDescription: Oracle Database@AWS lets you migrate your Oracle Exadata workloads, including Oracle RAC workloads, to Oracle Exadata Database Service on Dedicated Infrastructure within AWS.

shortDescription: Port Microsoft .NET Framework applications to .NET Core
detailDescription: Porting Assistant for .NET is a compatibility scanner that reduces the manual effort required to port Microsoft .NET Framework applications to .NET Core. The Porting Assistant for .NET assesses the .NET application source code and identifies incompatible APIs and third-party packages. Where applicable, the Porting Assistant for .NET also provides replacement suggestions that are compatible with .NET Core.

service: Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS
shortDescription: Managed OpenShift in the cloud
detailDescription: Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS (ROSA) is a managed service that helps Red Hat OpenShift users to build, scale, and manage containerized applications on AWS.

service: Research and Engineering Studio on AWS
shortDescription: Create and manage portals for research collaboration
detailDescription: Research and Engineering Studio on AWS is a framework for creating and managing a portal for research and engineering team collaboration.

shortDescription: Save on compute usage with flexible pricing
detailDescription: Savings Plans is a flexible pricing model that helps you save a significant percentage on Amazon EC2 and Fargate usage. Savings Plans provide low prices on Amazon EC2 and Fargate in exchange for a commitment to a consistent amount of usage for a one-year or three-year term.

shortDescription: Develop applications with Rust-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for Rust provides easy-to-use APIs and utilities developers can use to quickly integrate Rust applications with AWS services such as Amazon S3 and Amazon EC2.

shortDescription: Develop applications with a client library of modules
detailDescription: AWS SDK for SAP ABAP provides an interface to Amazon Web Services in ABAP. Using the SDK, you can build SAP applications on top of Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, DynamoDB, and more.

shortDescription: Develop applications with Swift-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The AWS SDK for Swift provides support for accessing Amazon Web Services infrastructure and services using the Swift language. Applications, servers, and libraries can be built on top of Amazon services including Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, DynamoDB, and more.

shortDescription: View and manage your AWS workload quotas easily and at scale
detailDescription: Service Quotas is a service for viewing and managing your quotas easily and at scale as your AWS workloads grow. Quotas, also referred to as limits, are the maximum number of resources that you can create in an AWS account.

shortDescription: Plugin for the Visual Studio integrated development environment (IDE)
detailDescription: The AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio is a plug-in for the Visual Studio integrated development environment (IDE). The Toolkit for Visual Studio makes it easier for developers to develop, debug, and deploy .NET applications that use Amazon Web Services.

service: Amazon Bedrock or Amazon SageMaker AI?
shortDescription: Determine which service is the best fit for your needs
detailDescription: Understand the differences between Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker AI, and determine which service is the best fit for your needs.

shortDescription: Real-time messaging, audio, video, and screen sharing
detailDescription: The Amazon Chime SDK allows builders to add real-time voice, video, and messaging powered by machine learning into their applications.

shortDescription: Automate lifecycle management of "golden" server images
detailDescription: EC2 Image Builder is a fully-managed AWS service that makes it easier to automate the creation, management, and deployment of customized, secure, and up-to-date “golden” server images that are pre-installed and pre-configured with software and settings to meet specific IT standards.

shortDescription: Explore which service better meets your needs for a compute web service
detailDescription: To explore whether Amazon Lightsail, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, or Amazon EC2 meets your needs for a cloud platform or compute web service.

shortDescription: Palm-based authentication for secure building access
Generative AI-powered assistants
detailDescription: Amazon Q Business is a generative artificial intelligence (generative AI)-powered assistant that you can tailor to your business needs. Amazon Q Developer is an AWS generative AI assistant that helps you understand, build, extend, and operate applications and workloads on AWS.

service: Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, or Amazon EventBridge?
shortDescription: Choose the best service for your needs
detailDescription: Understand the differences between Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, and EventBridge and determine which service is the best fit for your needs.

shortDescription: Scalable, open-source deep learning framework
detailDescription: Apache MXNet (MXNet) is an open source deep learning framework that allows you to define, train, and deploy deep neural networks on a wide array of platforms, from cloud infrastructure to mobile devices. It is highly scalable, which allows for fast model training, and supports a flexible programming model and multiple languages. The MXNet library is portable and lightweight, and it scales seamlessly to run on multiple GPUs and across multiple machines. MXNet supports programming in various languages to build and train deep learning models. Languages include Python, R, Scala, Julia, and Perl.

service: AWS Amplify (AWS Mobile SDK for Android)
shortDescription: Build native Android applications powered by AWS
detailDescription: Amplify Android is a collection of open-source client libraries that provides interfaces for specific use cases across many of the AWS services. Amplify Android is the recommended way to build native Android applications powered by AWS. You can also use the low-level AWS Mobile SDK for Android with Amplify Android if the use case you are trying to build is not currently available in Amplify Android.

service: AWS AmplifyiOS (AWS Mobile SDK for iOS)
shortDescription: Build native iOS applications powered by AWS
detailDescription: Amplify Library for Swift is a collection of open-source client libraries that provides interfaces for specific use cases across many of the AWS services. Amplify Library for Swift is the recommended way to build native iOS applications powered by AWS. You can also use the low-level AWS Mobile SDK for iOS with Amplify Library for Swift if the use case you are trying to build is not currently available in Amplify Library for Swift.

shortDescription: Understand the differences and pick the one that's right for you
detailDescription: To help you determine whether AWS CloudTrail or Amazon CloudWatch is the right choice for maintaining the visibility, security, and operational efficiency of your cloud environment.

shortDescription: Diagnostic tools for partners in the Partner-Led Support program
detailDescription: AWS Diagnostic Tools is a service that provides partners in the AWS Partner-Led Support program with an integrated dashboard of tools to diagnose and troubleshoot their customer's AWS accounts.

service: AWS End-of-Support Migration Program (EMP) for Windows Server
shortDescription: Migrate legacy apps to AWS supported versions without code refactoring
detailDescription: The End-of-Support Migration Program for Windows Server (EMP) migrates legacy applications from Windows Server 2003, 2008, and 2008 R2 to newer, supported versions on AWS without any code refactoring. The EMP technology decouples the application from the existing operating system and packages it with all necessary application files and components. The program then replatforms it to a supported version of the Windows operating system on AWS. After the migration, any outdated API calls are redirected, enabling the application to run on the latest versions of the Windows OS.

shortDescription: Explore which service better meets your needs for a serverless compute service
detailDescription: To explore whether AWS Fargate or AWS Lambda meet your needs for a serverless compute service.

Proactive monitoring and incident management for production workloads

shortDescription: Find .NET classes that enable games written with Unity to utilize AWS
detailDescription: The AWS Mobile SDK for Unity contains a set of .NET classes that enables games written with Unity to utilize AWS services. The AWS Unity Plug-in also contains sample code that illustrates how to call AWS services from a Unity game. The AWS Mobile SDK for Unity is compatible with Unity version 4.0 and greater.

shortDescription: Manage your AWS Partner Network (APN) membership and access AWS Partner resources
detailDescription: AWS Partner Central is a portal for AWS Partners to manage their AWS Partner Network membership. Access partner benefits, programs, training, and resources to build, market, sell, and grow with AWS.

Explore AWS learning opportunities

shortDescription: Find information applicable to multiple SDKs and tools
Security documentation by category
detailDescription: Cloud security at AWS is the highest priority. AWS customers benefit from data centers and network architectures that are built to meet the requirements of the most security-sensitive organizations. Use the following documentation to configure AWS services to meet your security and compliance objectives.

shortDescription: Introduction to core serverless concepts and services in the AWS Cloud
detailDescription: AWS provides a range of fully managed services that you can use to build serverless applications, such as AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon DynamoDB. To get started with serverless development in the AWS Cloud, review these serverless learning resources.

shortDescription: View the AWS workload quotas for AWS services
Add, edit, or delete tags on multiple AWS resources
detailDescription: Learn how to manage your AWS resources.

shortDescription: Assign metadata to your AWS resources in the form of tags
Reduce time and effort to refactor legacy .NET apps for AWS Cloud
detailDescription: AWS Toolkit for .NET Refactoring is an extension for Microsoft Visual Studio that reduces the time and effort necessary to refactor legacy .NET applications to cloud-native alternatives on AWS. Toolkit for .NET Refactoring assesses the application source code and recommends modernization pathways, such as porting to .NET Core. It also identifies Microsoft Windows dependencies on Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) and Microsoft Active Directory (AD), performs code modifications where possible, and assists in validating the refactored application on AWS services. Using the Toolkit for .NET Refactoring Visual Studio extension, you can perform all of these tasks within the Visual Studio integrated development environment (IDE).
